sentence.text: Numerous studies have recently demonstrated that protein deacetylation expression and activity are increased in kidney disease, such as autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease (ADPKD), renal fibrosis, and acute kidney injury (AKI), among others.

In transcription elongation from RNA polymerase II promoter, protein deacetylation inhibitors effectively limit the progression of kidney diseases, suggesting that targeting HDAC6 may provide a novel treatment approach.

entity.text: transcription elongation from RNA polymerase II promoter

sentence.text: Here, we discuss the unique function of protein deacetylation and recapitulate the alluring potential of its inhibitors in kidney diseases
